poem:
Title: Amidst the Ripples of Power

Autumn's skin,
pebbled with election promises,
discards the economy's shroud.  
Markets echo like vacant lots
filled with jobs never held,  
growing fast as dandelion fluff.  
Crumpled stock shares,
outlined in red and white,  
bespeak the soft cut
of unseen interest rates.  
Cast not your lot into the 
rapid stream of sameness,
a single dewdrop holds more truth
than any framed statistic.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "The unexpected message from the US for Keir Starmer: it’s not just the economy, stupid | Larry Elliott This November’s presidential election ought to be a doddle for Joe Biden. Fears of recession have receded. More Americans have jobs than ever before. Inflation is on a downward trend. Interest rates will be cut soon. The US economy is comfortably the fastest growing in the G7 group of leading industrial nations. Share prices are at a". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
